intro: Liabum poiteaui, commonly known as the Poitevin mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Liabum poiteaui is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens.
